title: Loose Women put Tony Christie on the spot over Jimmy Savile video
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

The Loose Women panel put Tony Christie on the spot on Monday’s show as they grilled him about Jimmy Savile being in one of his videos.

The singer appeared on the ITV programme to talk about his new book, but the interview was short when they asked him about his Amarillo remake with Peter Kay – which included Savile.

After Savile died in 2011, more than 450 alleged victims of sexual abuse reported incidents to the Metropolitan Police, with police concluding the Jim’ll Fix It star was a prolific sex offender.

‘You almost didn’t make the Amarillo video and while we were watching it when we were doing our research, we saw that Jimmy Savile was in the video,’ said panellist Jane Moore.

She continued: ‘I had a view that we can’t airbrush history, but he’s still in the video how do you feel about it?’

Tony awkwardly responded: ‘I haven’t seen it in ages, is it still online?

‘I got a phone call the night before to be on the video and I came down to do it.’

Jimmy Savile was in Tony Christie’s Amarillo video

Andrea McLean then cut the interview short and the show went to an ad break.

‘Sorry Tony we have to leave the interview there,’ she said.

Before his interview ended abruptly, Tony explained that his new book, The Song Interpreter, is about his life, his career and how he met the love of his life.

He told the Loose Women panel how he didn’t want to call the book Amarillo.

Things got a bit awkward in the interview (Picture: ITV)

‘I told the publishers you can call it what you like, just don’t have Amarillo in the title,’ he said.

‘It’s a fantastic song, I wish I could have a song like that every five years but I didn’t want to put it on a book.’

The star also spoke his dad and how he met his wife who he has been married to for 51 years.

He added: ‘ I was performing on stage in 1967 when a woman caught my eye and it was love at first sight.’

Loose Women viewers quickly flocked to Twitter following the Amarillo singer’s performance after things got a bit awkward.

One tweeted: ‘Bit unfair putting him on the spot about Jimmy Savile being in the video.’

Another commented: ‘Bloke’s absolutely petrified at the mention of Jimmy’

Loose Women airs weekdays at 12.30pm on ITV.
